properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the ACL.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Enables or disables the ACL. Set to true by default.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the ACL.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) List of tags that may be applied to the ACL.
In addition to the above, the following values are exported:

properties.name: uri
properties.description: The Uniform Resource Identifier for the ACL
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Image List.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Required) A description of the Image List.

properties.name: default
properties.description: • default - (Required) The image list entry to be used, by default, when launching instances using this image list. Defaults to 1.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Image List.

properties.name: machine_images
properties.description: • machine_images - (Required) An array of machine images.

properties.name: version
properties.description: • version - (Required) The unique version of the image list entry, as an integer.

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: • attributes - (Optional) JSON String of optional data that will be passed to an instance of this machine image when it is launched.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the instance.

properties.name: shape
properties.description: • shape - (Required) The shape of the instance, e.g. oc4.

properties.name: instance_attributes
properties.description: • instance_attributes - (Optional) A JSON string of custom attributes. See Attributes below for more information.

properties.name: boot_order
properties.description: • boot_order - (Optional) The index number of the bootable storage volume, presented as a list, that should be used to boot the instance. The only valid value is [1]. If you set this attribute, you must also specify a bootable storage volume with index number 1 in the volume sub-parameter of storage_attachments. When you specify boot_order, you don't need to specify the imagelist attribute, because the instance is booted using the image on the specified bootable storage volume. If you specify both boot_order and imagelist, the imagelist attribute is ignored.

properties.name: hostname
properties.description: • hostname - (Optional) The host name assigned to the instance. On an Oracle Linux instance, this host name is displayed in response to the hostname command. Only relative DNS is supported. The domain name is suffixed to the host name that you specify. The host name must not end with a period. If you don't specify a host name, then a name is generated automatically.

properties.name: image_list
properties.description: • image_list - (Optional) The imageList of the instance, e.g. /oracle/public/oel_6.4_2GB_v1.

properties.name: label
properties.description: • label - (Optional) The label to apply to the instance.

properties.name: desired_state
properties.description: • desired_state - (Optional) Set the desire state of the instance to running (default) or shutdown. You can use this request to shut down and restart individual instances which use a persistent bootable storage volume.

properties.name: networking_info
properties.description: • networking_info - (Optional) Information pertaining to an individual network interface to be created and attached to the instance. If left unspecified, the instance will be created within the shared_network. See Networking Info below for more information.

properties.name: storage
properties.description: • storage - (Optional) Information pertaining to an individual storage attachment to be created during instance creation. Please see Storage Attachments below for more information.

properties.name: reverse_dns
properties.description: • reverse_dns - (Optional) If set to true (default), then reverse DNS records are created. If set to false, no reverse DNS records are created.

properties.name: ssh_keys
properties.description: • ssh_keys - (Optional) A list of the names of the SSH Keys that can be used to log into the instance.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A list of strings that should be supplied to the instance as tags.

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: » Attributes

During instance creation, there are several custom attributes that a user may wish to make available to the instance during instance creation. These attributes can be specified via the instance_attributes field, and must be presented as a string in JSON format. The easiest way to populate this field is with a HEREDOC:

resource "opc_compute_instance" "foo" {
  name = "test"
  label = "test"
  shape = "oc3"
  imageList = "/oracle/public/oel_6.4_2GB_v1"
  instance_attributes = <<JSON
{
  "foo": "bar",
  "baz": 42,
  "my_obj": {
    "my_key": false,
    "another": true
  }
}
JSON

  sshKeys = ["${opc_compute_ssh_key.key1.name}"]
}

This allows the user to have full control over the attributes supplied to an instance during instance creation. There are, as well, some attributes that get populated during instance creation, and the full attributes map can be seen via the exported attributes attribute.

Warning: Due to how Terraform imports resources, the instance_attributes field will only be populated when creating a new instance with terraform. This requires us to ignore any state diffs on changes to the instance_attributes field. Thus, any configuration changes in the instance_attributes field, will not register a diff during a plan or apply. If a user wishes to make a change solely to the supplied instance attributes, and recreate the instance resource, terraform taint is the best solution. You can read more about the taint command here

properties.name: networking-info
properties.description: » Networking Info

Each networking_info config manages a single network interface for the instance. The attributes are either required or optional depending on whether or not the interface is in the Shared Network, or an IP Network. Some attributes can only be used if the interface is in the Shared Network, and same for an interface in an IP Network.
Note: If networking_info is left unspecified, the instance will be booted in the shared_network.
The following attributes are supported:

properties.name: index
properties.description: (Required) The numerical index of the network interface. Specified as an integer to allow for use of count, but directly maps to ethX. ie: With index set to 0, the interface eth0 will be created. Can only be 0-9.

properties.name: dns
properties.description: (Optional, IP Network Only) List of DNS A record names for the instance. You can specify up to eight DNS A record names for each interface on an IP network. These names can be queried by instances on any IP network in the same IP network exchange.

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: (Optional, IP Network Only) IP Address assigned to the interface.

properties.name: ip_network
properties.description: (Optional, IP Network Only) The IP Network assigned to the interface.

properties.name: mac_address
properties.description: (Optional, IP Network Only) The MAC address of the interface.

properties.name: is_default_gateway
properties.description: (Optional, IP Network Only) Specify the interface is to be used as the default gateway for all traffic. Only one interface on an instance can be specified as the default gateway. If the instance has an interface on the shared network, that interface is always used as the default gateway.

properties.name: model
properties.description: (Optional, Shared Network Only) The model of the NIC card used. Must be set to e1000.

properties.name: name_servers
properties.description: (Optional) Array of name servers for the interface.

properties.name: nat
properties.description:
(Optional for IP Networks, Required for the Shared Network) The IP Reservations associated with the interface (IP Network).
Indicates whether a temporary or permanent public IP address should be assigned to the instance (Shared Network).

properties.name: search_domains
properties.description: (Optional) The search domains that are sent through DHCP as option 119.

properties.name: sec_lists
properties.description: (Optional, Shared Network Only) The security lists the interface is added to.

properties.name: shared_network
properties.description: (Required) Whether or not the interface is inside the Shared Network or an IP Network.

properties.name: vnic
properties.description: (Optional, IP Network Only) The name of the vNIC created for the IP Network.

properties.name: vnic_sets
properties.description: (Optional, IP Network Only) The array of vNIC Sets the interface was added to.

properties.name: storage-attachments
properties.description: » Storage Attachments

Each Storage Attachment config manages a single storage attachment that is created during instance creation. This means that any storage attachments created during instance creation cannot be detached from the instance. Use the resource_storage_attachment resource to manage storage attachments for instances if you wish to detach the storage volumes at a later date.
The following attributes are supported:

properties.name: index
properties.description: (Required) The Index number of the volume attachment. 1 is the boot volume for the instance. Values 1-10 allowed.

properties.name: volume
properties.description: (Required) The name of the storage volume to attach to the instance.
In addition to the above attributes, the following attributes are exported for a storage volume

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the storage volume attachment.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the ip address association.

properties.name: ip_address_reservation
properties.description: • ip_address_reservation - (Optional) The name of the NAT IP address reservation.

properties.name: vnic
properties.description: • vnic - (Optional) The name of the virtual NIC associated with this NAT IP reservation.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the ip address association.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) List of tags that may be applied to the ip address association.
In addition to the above, the following variables are exported:

properties.name: uri
properties.description: (Computed) The Uniform Resource Identifier of the ip address association.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the ip address prefix set.

properties.name: prefixes
properties.description: • prefixes - (Optional) List of CIDR IPv4 prefixes assigned in the virtual network.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the ip address prefix set.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) List of tags that may be applied to the ip address prefix set.
In addition to the above, the following variables are exported:

properties.name: uri
properties.description: (Computed) The Uniform Resource Identifier of the ip address prefix set.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the ip address reservation.

properties.name: ip_address_pool
properties.description: • ip_address_pool - (Required) The IP address pool from which you want to reserve an IP address. Typically one of either public-ippool or cloud-ippool.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the ip address reservation.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) List of tags that may be applied to the IP address reservation.
In addition to the above, the following attributes are exported:

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: • ip_address - Reserved NAT IPv4 address from the IP address pool.

properties.name: uri
properties.description: • uri - The Uniform Resource Identifier of the ip address reservation
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: vcable
properties.description: • vcable - (Required) The vcable of the instance to associate the IP address with.

properties.name: parent_pool
properties.description: • parent_pool - (Required) The pool from which to take an IP address. To associate a specific reserved IP address, use the prefix ipreservation: followed by the name of the IP reservation. To allocate an IP address from a pool, use the prefix ippool:, e.g. ippool:/oracle/public/ippool.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the IP Network. Changing this name forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: ip_address_prefix
properties.description: • ip_address_prefix - (Required) The IPv4 address prefix, in CIDR format.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The description of the IP Network.

properties.name: ip_network_exchange
properties.description: • ip_network_exchange - (Optional) Specify the IP Network exchange to which the IP Network belongs to.

properties.name: public_napt_enabled
properties.description: • public_napt_enabled - (Optional) If true, enable public internet access using NAPT for VNICs without any public IP Reservation. Defaults to false.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the ip network exchange.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the ip network exchange.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) List of tags that may be applied to the IP network exchange.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: permanent
properties.description: • permanent - (Required) Whether the IP address remains reserved even when it is no longer associated with an instance (if true), or may be returned to the pool and replaced with a different IP address when an instance is restarted, or deleted and recreated (if false).

properties.name: parent_pool
properties.description: • parent_pool - (Optional) The pool from which to allocate the IP address. Defaults to /oracle/public/ippool, and is currently the only acceptable input.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Name of the IP Reservation. Will be generated if unspecified.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) List of tags that may be applied to the IP reservation.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: account
properties.description: • account - (Required) The two part name of the compute object storage account in the format /Compute-{identity_domain}/cloud_storage

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Machine Image.

properties.name: file
properties.description: • file - (Required) The name of the Machine Image .tar.gz file in the compute_images storage container.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the Machine Image.

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: • attributes - (Optional) An optional JSON object of arbitrary attributes to be made available to the instance. These are user-defined tags. After defining attributes, you can view them from within an instance at http://192.0.0.192/
In addition to the above, the following values are exported:

properties.name: error_reason
properties.description: • error_reason - Description of the state of the machine image if there is an error.

properties.name: hypervisor
properties.description: • hypervisor - Dictionary of hypervisor-specific attributes.

properties.name: image_format
properties.description: • image_format - The format of the image.

properties.name: platform
properties.description: • platform - The OS platform of the image.

properties.name: state
properties.description: • state - The state of the uploaded machine image.

properties.name: uri
properties.description: • uri - The Uniform Resource Identifier for the Machine Image.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the orchestration.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: desired_state - (Required) The desired state of the orchestration. Permitted values are:

properties.name: active
properties.description: : all resource (instances) declared in the orchestration are created

properties.name: suspend
properties.description: : all resources (instances) declared in the orchestration are removed unless the instances has persistent = true

properties.name: inactive
properties.description: : all resources (instances) declared in the orchestration are removed including the instances that have persistent = true

properties.name: instance
properties.description: • instance - (Required) The information pertaining to creating an instance through the orchestration API.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The description of the orchestration.

properties.name: instance-1
properties.description: » Instance
Instance supports the arguments found in opc_compute_instance and the following:

properties.name: persistent
properties.description: (Optional) Determines whether the instance will persist when the orchestration is suspended. Defaults to false.
In addition to the above, the following values are exported:

properties.name: uri
properties.description: • uri - The Uniform Resource Identifier for the Orchestration

properties.name: version
properties.description: • version - (Optional) The version of the orchestration.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the route.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The description of the route.

properties.name: admin_distance
properties.description: • admin_distance - (Optional) The route's administrative distance. Defaults to 0.

properties.name: ip_address_prefix
properties.description: • ip_address_prefix - (Required) The IPv4 address prefix, in CIDR format, of the external network from which to route traffic.

properties.name: next_hop_vnic_set
properties.description: • next_hop_vnic_set - (Required) Name of the virtual NIC set to route matching packets to. Routed flows are load-balanced among all the virtual NICs in the virtual NIC set.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The unique (within the identity domain) name of the security rule.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description for this security rule.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: source_list - (Required) The source security list (prefixed with seclist:), or security IP list (prefixed with seciplist:).

properties.name: destination_list
properties.description: (Required) The destination security list (prefixed with seclist:), or security IP list (prefixed with seciplist:).

properties.name: application
properties.description: • application - (Required) The name of the application to which the rule applies.

properties.name: action
properties.description: • action - (Required) Whether to permit, refuse or deny packets to which this rule applies. This will ordinarily be permit.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: • disabled - (Optional) Whether to disable this security rule. This is useful if you want to temporarily disable a rule without removing it outright from your Terraform resource definition. Defaults to false.
In addition to the above, the following values are exported:

properties.name: uri
properties.description: The Uniform Resource Identifier of the sec rule.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The unique (within the identity domain) name of the application

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Required) The protocol to enable for this application. Must be one of tcp, udp, ah, esp, icmp, icmpv6, igmp, ipip, gre, mplsip, ospf, pim, rdp, sctp or all.

properties.name: dport
properties.description: • dport - (Required) The port, or range of ports, to enable for this application, e.g 8080, 6000-7000. This must be set if the protocol is set to tcp or udp.

properties.name: icmptype
properties.description: • icmptype - (Optional) The ICMP type to enable for this application, if the protocol is icmp. Must be one of echo, reply, ttl, traceroute, unreachable.

properties.name: icmpcode
properties.description: • icmpcode - (Optional) The ICMP code to enable for this application, if the protocol is icmp. Must be one of admin, df, host, network, port or protocol.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) The Name for the Security Association. If not specified, one is created automatically. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: vcable
properties.description: • vcable - (Required) The vcable of the instance to associate to the security list.

properties.name: seclist
properties.description: • seclist - (Required) The name of the security list to associate the instance to.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The unique (within the identity domain) name of the security IP list.

properties.name: ip_entries
properties.description: • ip_entries - (Required) The IP addresses to include in the list.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) The description of the security ip list.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The unique (within the identity domain) name of the security list.

properties.name: policy
properties.description: • policy - (Required) The policy to apply to instances associated with this list. Must be one of permit, reject (packets are dropped but a reply is sent) and deny (packets are dropped and no reply is sent).

properties.name: output_cidr_policy
properties.description: • output_cidr_policy - (Required) The policy for outbound traffic from the security list. Must be one of permit, reject (packets are dropped but a reply is sent) and deny (packets are dropped and no reply is sent).
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the security protocol.

properties.name: dst_ports
properties.description: • dst_ports (Optional) Enter a list of port numbers or port range strings. Traffic is enabled by a security rule when a packet's destination port matches the ports specified here. For TCP, SCTP, and UDP, each port is a destination transport port, between 0 and 65535, inclusive. For ICMP, each port is an ICMP type, between 0 and 255, inclusive. If no destination ports are specified, all destination ports or ICMP types are allowed.

properties.name: src_ports
properties.description: • src_ports (Optional) Enter a list of port numbers or port range strings. Traffic is enabled by a security rule when a packet's source port matches the ports specified here. For TCP, SCTP, and UDP, each port is a source transport port, between 0 and 65535, inclusive. For ICMP, each port is an ICMP type, between 0 and 255, inclusive. If no source ports are specified, all source ports or ICMP types are allowed.

properties.name: ip_protocol
properties.description: • ip_protocol (Optional) The protocol used in the data portion of the IP datagram. Permitted values are: tcp, udp, icmp, igmp, ipip, rdp, esp, ah, gre, icmpv6, ospf, pim, sctp, mplsip, all. Traffic is enabled by a security rule when the protocol in the packet matches the protocol specified here. If no protocol is specified, all protocols are allowed.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the security protocol.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) List of tags that may be applied to the security protocol.
In addition to the above, the following values are exported:

properties.name: uri
properties.description: The Uniform Resource Identifier for the Security Protocol
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the security rule.

properties.name: flow_direction
properties.description: • flow_direction - (Required) Specify the direction of flow of traffic, which is relative to the instances, for this security rule. Allowed values are ingress or egress.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: • disabled - (Optional) Whether to disable this security rule. This is useful if you want to temporarily disable a rule without removing it outright from your Terraform resource definition. Defaults to false.

properties.name: acl
properties.description: • acl - (Optional) Name of the ACL that contains this security rule.

properties.name: dst_ip_address_prefixes
properties.description: • dst_ip_address_prefixes - (Optional) List of IP address prefix set names to match the packet's destination IP address.

properties.name: src_ip_address_prefixes
properties.description: • src_ip_address_prefixes - (Optional) List of names of IP address prefix set to match the packet's source IP address.

properties.name: dst_vnic_set
properties.description: • dst_vnic_set - (Optional) Name of virtual NIC set containing the packet's destination virtual NIC.

properties.name: src_vnic_set
properties.description: • src_vnic_set - (Optional) Name of virtual NIC set containing the packet's source virtual NIC.

properties.name: security_protocols
properties.description: • security_protocols - (Optional) List of security protocol object names to match the packet's protocol and port.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the security rule.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) List of tags that may be applied to the security rule.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The unique (within this identity domain) name of the SSH key.

properties.name: key
properties.description: • key - (Required) The SSH key itself

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Whether or not the key is enabled. This is useful if you want to temporarily disable an SSH key, without removing it entirely from your Terraform resource definition. Defaults to true
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: instance
properties.description: • instance - (Required) The name of the instance the volume will be attached to.

properties.name: storage_volume
properties.description: • storage_volume - (Required) The name of the storage volume that will be attached to the instance

properties.name: index
properties.description: • index - (Required) The index on the instance that the storage volume will be attached to.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name for the Storage Account.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) The description of the storage volume.

properties.name: size
properties.description: (Required) The size of this storage volume in GB. The allowed range is from 1 GB to 2 TB (2048 GB).

properties.name: storage_type
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: bootable
properties.description: (Optional) Is the Volume Bootable? Defaults to false.

properties.name: image_list
properties.description: (Optional) Defines an image list.

properties.name: image_list_entry
properties.description: (Optional) Defines an image list entry.

properties.name: snapshot
properties.description: (Optional) The name of the parent snapshot from which the storage volume is restored or cloned. See Snapshots, below for more information.

properties.name: snapshot_id
properties.description: (Optional) The Id of the parent snapshot from which the storage volume is restored or cloned. See Snapshots, below for more information.

properties.name: snapshot_account
properties.description: (Optional) The Account of the parent snapshot from which the storage volume is restored. See Snapshots, below for more information.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: (Optional) Comma-separated strings that tag the storage volume.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: volume_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the storage volume to create the snapshot from.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) The description of the storage volume snapshot.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Optional) The name of the storage volume snapshot. Will be generated if unspecified.

properties.name: parent_volume_bootable
properties.description: (Optional) A string value of whether or not the parent volume is 'bootable' or not. Defaults to "false".

properties.name: collocated
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean specifying whether the snapshot is collocated or remote. Defaults to false.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: (Optional) Comma-separated strings that tag the storage volume.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The unique (within this identity domain) name of the virtual nic set.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the virtual nic set.

properties.name: applied_acls
properties.description: • applied_acls - (Optional) A list of the ACLs to apply to the virtual nics in the set.

properties.name: virtual_nics
properties.description: • virtual_nics - (Optional) List of virtual NICs associated with this virtual NIC set.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A list of tags to apply to the storage volume.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the VPN Endpoint V2.

properties.name: customer_vpn_gateway
properties.description: • customer_vpn_gateway - (Required) The ip address of the VPN gateway in your data center through which you want to connect to the Oracle Cloud VPN gateway.

properties.name: ip_network
properties.description: • ip_network - (Required) The name of the IP network on which the cloud gateway is created by VPNaaS.

properties.name: pre_shared_key
properties.description: • pre_shared_key - (Required) The pre-shared VPN key

properties.name: reachable_routes
properties.description: • reachable_routes - (Required) A list of routes (CIDR prefixes) that are reachable through this VPN tunnel.

properties.name: vnic_sets
properties.description: • vnic_sets - (Required) A list of vnic sets that traffics is allowed to and from.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the VPN Endpoint V2.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Enables or disables the VPN Endpoint V2. Set to true by default.

properties.name: ike_identifier
properties.description: • ike_identifier - (Optional) The Internet Key Exchange (IKE) ID. If you don't specify a value, the default value is the public IP address of the cloud gateway.

properties.name: require_perfect_forward_secrecy
properties.description: • require_perfect_forward_secrecy - (Optional) Boolean specifying whether Perfect Forward Secrecy is enabled. Set to true by default.

properties.name: phase_one_settings
properties.description: • phase_one_settings - (Optional) Settings for the phase one protocol (IKE). Phase One Settings are detailed below.

properties.name: phase_two_settings
properties.description: • phase_two_settings - (Optional) Settings for the phase two protocol (IPSEC). Phase Two Settings are detailed below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) List of tags that may be applied to the VPN Endpoint V2.
Phase One Settings support the following:

properties.name: encryption
properties.description: • encryption - (Required) IKE Encryption. aes128, aes192 or aes256

properties.name: hash
properties.description: • hash - (Required) IKE Hash. sha1, sha2_256 or md5

properties.name: dh_group
properties.description: • dh_group - (Required) Diffie-Hellman group for both IKE and ESP. group2, group5, group14, group22, group23, or group24

properties.name: lifetime
properties.description: • lifetime - (Optional) IKE Lifetime in seconds.
Phase Two Settings support the following:

properties.name: encryption
properties.description: • encryption - (Required) ESP Encryption. aes128, aes192 or aes256

properties.name: hash
properties.description: • hash - (Required) ESP Hash. sha1, sha2_256 or md5

properties.name: lifetime
properties.description: • lifetime - (Optional) IPSEC Lifetime in seconds.
In addition to the above, the following values are exported:

properties.name: local_gateway_ip_address
properties.description: • local_gateway_ip_address - Public IP Address of the Local Gateway.

properties.name: local_gateway_private_ip_address
properties.description: • local_gateway_private_ip_address - Private IP Address of the Local Gateway.

properties.name: uri
properties.description: • uri - The Uniform Resource Identifier for the VPN Endpoint V2.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Certificate.

properties.name: certificate_body
properties.description: • certificate_body - (Required) The Certificate data in PEM format.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) Sets the Certificate Type. TRUSTED or SERVER.

properties.name: certificate_chain
properties.description: • certificate_chain - (Optional) PEM encoded bodies of all certificates in the chain up to and including the CA certificate. This is not need when the certificate is self signed.

properties.name: private_key
properties.description: • private_key - (Optional) The private key data in PEM format. Only required for Server Certificates

properties.name: additional-attributes
properties.description: » Additional Attributes
In addition to the above, the following values are exported:

properties.name: state
properties.description: • state - The State of the Digital Certificate resource.

properties.name: uri
properties.description: • uri - The Uniform Resource Identifier for the Certificate resource.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Listener.

properties.name: load_balancer
properties.description: • load_balancer - (Required) The parent Load Balancer the Listener.

properties.name: balancer_protocol
properties.description: • balancer_protocol - (Required) transport protocol that will be accepted for all incoming requests to the selected load balancer listener. HTTP or HTTPS. If set to HTTPS then you must also set the server certificates.

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Required) The port on which the Load Balancer is listening.

properties.name: server_protocol
properties.description: • server_protocol - (Required) The protocol to be used for routing traffic to the origin servers in the server pool. HTTP or HTTPS. If set to HTTPS then you must include a Trusted Certificate Policy in the policies

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Boolean flag to enable or disable the Listener. Default is true (enabled).

properties.name: path_prefixes
properties.description: • path_prefixes - (Optional) List of paths to configure the listener to accept only requests that are targeted to a specific path within the URI of the request.

properties.name: polices
properties.description: • polices - (Optional) List of the Load Balancer Policy URIs to apply to the listener.

properties.name: server_pool
properties.description: • server_pool - (Optional) URI of the Server Pool resource to which the load balancer distributes requests.

properties.name: certificates
properties.description: • certificates - (Optional) The URI of the server security certificate.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) List of tags.

properties.name: virtual_hosts
properties.description: • virtual_hosts - (Optional) Configure the listener to only accept URI requests that include the host names listed in this field.

properties.name: additional-attributes
properties.description: » Additional Attributes
In addition to the above, the following values are exported:

properties.name: operational_details
properties.description: • operational_details - Description of the operational state.

properties.name: parent_listener
properties.description: • parent_listener - The parent Listener.

properties.name: state
properties.description: • state - State of the Origin Server Pool.

properties.name: uri
properties.description: • uri - The Uniform Resource Identifier for the Listner.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Load Balancer.

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Required) The region in which to create the Load Balancer, e.g. uscom-central-1

properties.name: list description
properties.description: scheme - (Required) Set to either INTERNET_FACING or INTERNAL

properties.name: INTERNET_FACING
properties.description: Create an internet-facing load balancer in a given IP network.

properties.name: INTERNAL
properties.description: Create an internal load balancer in a given IP network for sole consumption of other clients inside the same network.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A short description for the load balancer. The description must not exceed 1000 characters.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Boolean flag to enable or disable the Load Balancer. Default is true (enabled).

properties.name: ip_network
properties.description: • ip_network - (Optional) Fully qualified three part name of the IP network to be associated with the load balancer.

properties.name: parent_load_balancer
properties.description: • parent_load_balancer - (Optional) Select a parent load balancer if you want to create a dependent load balancer.

properties.name: permitted_clients
properties.description: • permitted_clients - (Optional) List of permitted client IP addresses or CIDR ranges which can connect to this load balancer on the configured Listener ports. If not set all connections are permitted.

properties.name: permitted_methods
properties.description: • permitted_methods - (Optional) List of permitted HTTP methods. e.g. GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD or you can also create your own custom methods. Requests with methods not listed in this field will result in a 403 (unauthorized access) response.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) List of tags.

properties.name: additional-attributes
properties.description: » Additional Attributes
In addition to the above, the following values are exported:

properties.name: operational_details
properties.description: • operational_details - Description of the operational state.

properties.name: state
properties.description: • state - State of the Origin Server Pool.

properties.name: status
properties.description: • status - Status of the Origin Server Pool.

properties.name: uri
properties.description: • uri - The Uniform Resource Identifier for the Load Balancer.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Listener.

properties.name: load_balancer
properties.description: • load_balancer - (Required) The parent Load Balancer the Listener.
Include one, and only one, of:

properties.name: application_cookie_stickiness_policy
properties.description: • application_cookie_stickiness_policy - see Application Cookie Stickiness Policy

properties.name: cloudgate_policy
properties.description: • cloudgate_policy - see CloudGate Policy

properties.name: load_balancer_cookie_stickiness_policy
properties.description: • load_balancer_cookie_stickiness_policy - see Load Balancer Cookie Stickiness Policy

properties.name: load_balancing_mechanism_policy
properties.description: • load_balancing_mechanism_policy - see Load Balancing Mechanism Policy

properties.name: rate_limiting_request_policy
properties.description: • rate_limiting_request_policy - see Rate Limiting Request Policy

properties.name: redirect_policy
properties.description: • redirect_policy - see Redirect Policy

properties.name: resource_access_control_policy
properties.description: • resource_access_control_policy - see Resource Access Control Policy

properties.name: set_request_header_policy
properties.description: • set_request_header_policy - see Set Request Header Policy

properties.name: ssl_negotiation_policy
properties.description: • ssl_negotiation_policy - see SSL Negotiation Policy

properties.name: trusted_certificate_policy
properties.description: • trusted_certificate_policy - see Trusted Certificate Policy

properties.name: application-cookie-stickiness-policy
properties.description: » Application Cookie Stickiness Policy
Enable session stickiness (session affinity) for any request based on a given cookie name specified in the policy.

properties.name: example
properties.description: » Example

resource "opc_lbaas_policy" "application_cookie_stickiness_policy" {
  load_balancer = "${opc_lbaas_load_balancer.lb1.id}"
  name          = "example_application_cookie_stickiness_policy"

  application_cookie_stickiness_policy {
    cookie_name = "MY_APP_COOKIE"
  }
}

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: » Attributes

properties.name: cookie_name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the application cookie used to control how long the load balancer will continue to route requests to the same origin server.

properties.name: cloudgate-policy
properties.description: » CloudGate Policy

protect resources/applications with the help of CloudGate module available in Load Balancer. These headers will enable CloudGate to lookup for the application and the policy present under the appropriate IDCS Tenant containing information for the protection mechanism to be enforced.

properties.name: example-1
properties.description: » Example

resource "opc_lbaas_policy" "cloudgate_policy" {
  load_balancer = "${opc_lbaas_load_balancer.lb1.id}"
  name          = "example_cloudgate_policy"

  cloudgate_policy {
    virtual_hostname_for_policy_attribution = "host1.example.com"
  }
}

properties.name: attributes-1
properties.description: » Attributes

properties.name: virtual_hostname_for_policy_attribution
properties.description: (Required) Host name needed by CloudGate to enforce OAuth policies.

properties.name: load-balancer-cookie-stickiness-policy
properties.description: » Load Balancer Cookie Stickiness Policy
Enables session stickiness (session affinity) for all requests for a given period of time specified in the policy.

properties.name: example-2
properties.description: » Example

resource "opc_lbaas_policy" "load_balancer_cookie_stickiness_policy" {
  load_balancer = "${opc_lbaas_load_balancer.lb1.id}"
  name          = "example_load_balancer_cookie_stickiness_policy"

  load_balancer_cookie_stickiness_policy {
    cookie_expiration_period = 60
  }
}

properties.name: attributes-2
properties.description: » Attributes

properties.name: cookie_expiration_period
properties.description: (Required) The time period, in seconds, after which the cookie should be considered stale. If the value is zero or negative the stickiness session lasts for the duration of the browser session.

properties.name: load-balancing-mechanism-policy
properties.description: » Load Balancing Mechanism Policy
Specify a load balancing mechanism for distributing client requests across multiple origin servers

properties.name: example-3
properties.description: » Example

resource "opc_lbaas_policy" "load_balancing_mechanism_policy" {
  load_balancer = "${opc_lbaas_load_balancer.lb1.id}"
  name          = "example_load_balancing_mechanism_policy"

  load_balancing_mechanism_policy {
    load_balancing_mechanism = "round_robin"
  }
}

properties.name: attributes-3
properties.description: » Attributes

properties.name: load_balancing_mechanism
properties.description: (Required) Supported options are round_robin, least_conn, and ip_hash.

properties.name: rate-limiting-request-policy
properties.description: » Rate Limiting Request Policy
Limits the number of requests that can be processed per second by the load balancer.

properties.name: example-4
properties.description: » Example

resource "opc_lbaas_policy" "rate_limiting_request_policy" {
  load_balancer = "${opc_lbaas_load_balancer.lb1.id}"
  name          = "example_rate_limiting_request_policy"

  rate_limiting_request_policy {
    requests_per_second      = 1
    burst_size               = 10
    delay_excessive_requests = true
    zone                     = "examplezone"
  }
}

properties.name: attributes-4
properties.description: » Attributes

properties.name: burst_size
properties.description: • burst_size - (Required) The number of requests that can be delayed until it exceeds the maximum number specified as burst size in which case the request is terminated.

properties.name: delay_excessive_requests
properties.description: • delay_excessive_requests - (Required) delay excessive requests while requests are being limited.

properties.name: requests_per_second
properties.description: • requests_per_second - (Required) Maximum number of requests per second.

properties.name: zone
properties.description: • zone - (Required) Name of the shared memory zone.

properties.name: http_error_code
properties.description: • http_error_code - (Optional) Status code to return in response to rejected requests. You can specify any status code between 405 to 599. Default is 503

properties.name: logging_level
properties.description: • logging_level - (Optional) Logging level for cases when the server refuses to process requests due to rate exceeding, or delays request processing. Can be one of info, notice, warn, or error. Default is warn

properties.name: list description
properties.description: rate_limiting_criteria - (Optional) Criteria based on which requests will be throttled. Default is server

properties.name: server
properties.description: limit the requests processed by the virtual server

properties.name: remote_address
properties.description: limit the processing rate of requests coming from a single IP address.

properties.name: host
properties.description: limit the processing rate of requests coming from a host.

properties.name: zone_memory_size
properties.description: • zone_memory_size - (Optional) Size of the shared memory occupied by the zone. Default is 10

properties.name: redirect-policy
properties.description: » Redirect Policy
Redirects all requests to this load balancer to a specific URI.

properties.name: example-5
properties.description: » Example

resource "opc_lbaas_policy" "redirect_policy" {
  load_balancer = "${opc_lbaas_load_balancer.lb1.id}"
  name          = "example_redirect_policy"

  redirect_policy {
    redirect_uri = "https://redirect.example.com"
    response_code = 306
  }
}

properties.name: attributes-5
properties.description: » Attributes

properties.name: redirect_uri
properties.description: • redirect_uri - (Required) redirected requests to the specified URI.

properties.name: response_code
properties.description: • response_code - (Required) The exact 3xx response code to use when redirecting

properties.name: resource-access-control-policy
properties.description: » Resource Access Control Policy
Controls what clients have access to the load balancer, based on the IP address or the CIDR range of the incoming request.

properties.name: example-6
properties.description: » Example

resource "opc_lbaas_policy" "resource_access_control_policy" {
  load_balancer = "${opc_lbaas_load_balancer.lb1.id}"
  name          = "example_resource_access_control_policy"

  resource_access_control_policy {
    disposition = "DENY_ALL"
    permitted_clients = ["10.0.0.0/16"]
  }
}

properties.name: attributes-6
properties.description: » Attributes

properties.name: disposition
properties.description: • disposition - (Required) Default policy. DENY_ALL or PERMIT_ALL.

properties.name: denied_clients
properties.description: • denied_clients - (Optional) List of IP address or CIDR ranges identifying clients from which requests must be accepted by the Load Balancer

properties.name: permitted_clients
properties.description: • permitted_clients - (Optional) IP address or CIDR ranges identifying clients from which requests must be denied by the Load Balancer.

properties.name: set-request-header-policy
properties.description: » Set Request Header Policy
Inserts additional information into the standard HTTP headers of requests forwarded to a server pool.

properties.name: example-7
properties.description: » Example

resource "opc_lbaas_policy" "set_request_header_policy" {
  load_balancer = "${opc_lbaas_load_balancer.lb1.id}"
  name          = "example_set_request_header_policy"

  set_request_header_policy {
    header_name                     = "X-Custom-Header"
    value                           = "foo-bar  "
    action_when_header_exists       = "OVERWRITE"
    action_when_header_value_is     = ["bar", "foo"]
  }
}

properties.name: attributes-7
properties.description: » Attributes

properties.name: header_name
properties.description: • header_name - (Required)

properties.name: action_when_header_exists
properties.description: • action_when_header_exists - (Required) action to be taken when a header exists in the request. Options: NOOP, PREPEND, APPEND, OVERWRITE, CLEAR

properties.name: action_when_header_value_is
properties.description: • action_when_header_value_is - (Optional) List if header values. Action is taken only when the header exists in the request and the header value matches one of the values provided.

properties.name: action_when_header_value_is_not
properties.description: • action_when_header_value_is_not - (Optional) List if header values. Action is taken only when the header exists in the request and the header value does not match any of the values provided.

properties.name: ssl-negotiation-policy
properties.description: » SSL Negotiation Policy
Define specific SSL protocols, ciphers, and server order preference for the secure connection

properties.name: example-8
properties.description: » Example

resource "opc_lbaas_policy" "ssl_negotiation_policy" {
  load_balancer = "${opc_lbaas_load_balancer.lb1.id}"
  name          = "example_ssl_negitiation_policy"

  ssl_negotiation_policy {
    port = 8022
    server_order_preference = "ENABLED"
    ssl_protocol = ["SSLv3", "TLSv1.2"]
    ssl_ciphers = ["AES256-SHA"]
  }
}

properties.name: attributes-8
properties.description: » Attributes

properties.name: ssl_protocol
properties.description: • ssl_protocol - (Required) Security protocols supported for incoming secure client connections to the associated listener. Supported options are SSLv2, SSLv3, TLSv1, TLSv1.1, TLSv1.2

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Optional) The load balancer port for the the SSL protocols and the SSL ciphers.

properties.name: server_order_preference
properties.description: • server_order_preference - (Optional) enable or disable the server order preference for secure connections to associated Listener. ENABLED or DISABLED.

properties.name: ssl_ciphers
properties.description: • ssl_ciphers - (Optional) List of SSL ciphers supported for incoming secure client connections to the associated Listener.

properties.name: trusted-certificate-policy
properties.description: » Trusted Certificate Policy

Identifies a trusted certificate, which the load balancer uses when making a secure connection to the compute instances in the server pool. If you are configuring a secure connection (HTTPS or SSL) between the load balancer and the origin servers, you must add this policy to the load balancer.

properties.name: example-9
properties.description: » Example

resource "opc_lbaas_policy" "trusted_certificate_policy" {
  load_balancer = "${opc_lbaas_load_balancer.lb1.id}"
  name          = "example_trusted_certificate_policy"

  trusted_certificate_policy {
    trusted_certificate = "${opc_lbaas_ssl_certificate.cert1.uri}"
  }
}

properties.name: attributes-9
properties.description: » Attributes

properties.name: trusted_certificate
properties.description: (Required) URI of the SSL Certificate

properties.name: additional-attributes
properties.description: » Additional Attributes
In addition to the above, the following values are exported:

properties.name: state
properties.description: • state - State of the Policy.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - The Type of the Policy.

properties.name: uri
properties.description: • uri - The Uniform Resource Identifier for the Policy.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Server Pool.

properties.name: load_balancer
properties.description: • load_balancer - (Required) The parent Load Balancer the Origin Server Pool.

properties.name: servers
properties.description: • servers - (Required) List of servers in the Server Pool. To define the server in the server pool, provide IP address or DNS name of the compute instances, and port for load balancer to direct traffic to, in the format host:port

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Boolean flag to enable or disable the Server Pool. Default is true (enabled).

properties.name: health_check
properties.description: • health_check - (Optional) Enables Load Balancer health check, see Health Check Attributes

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) List of tags.

properties.name: vnic_set
properties.description: • vnic_set - (Optional) Fully qualified three part name of a vNICSet to be associated with the server pool vNIC. Load Balancer uses this vNICSet to set the right ACLs to allow egress traffic from the load balancer.

properties.name: heath-check-attributes
properties.description: » Heath Check Attributes
The load balancer can perform regular health checks of the origin servers and route inbound traffic to the healthy origin servers.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: type - (Optional) Health check mechanism to use to test the origin servers. Default is http

properties.name: http
properties.description: sends an HTTP HEAD to the set path and checks response is in one of the accepted_return_codes

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Optional) The path to check. Set the '/' the check all paths. Default is '/'

properties.name: accepted_return_codes
properties.description: • accepted_return_codes - (Optional) List of HTTP response status codes that indicate the origin server is healthy. Accepted return codes can be one or more of the 2xx, 3xx, 4xx, or 5xx codes. Default is ["2xx","3xx"].

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Boolean flag to enable or disable the Health Checks. Default is true (enabled).

properties.name: interval
properties.description: • interval - (Optional) The approximate interval, in seconds, that the load balancer will wait before sending the target request to each origin server, in the range 5 to 300 seconds. Default is 30.

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: • timeout - (Optional) The amount of time, in seconds, that the load balancer will wait without a response before identifying the origin server as unavailable. The timeout value must be less than the interval value and it should range between 2 to 60. Default is 20.

properties.name: healthy_threshold
properties.description: • healthy_threshold - (Optional) The number of consecutive successful health checks required before moving the origin server to the healthy state. The value of healthy threshold ranges from 2 to 10. Default is 5.

properties.name: unhealthy_threshold
properties.description: • unhealthy_threshold - (Optional) The number of consecutive health check failures required before moving the origin server to the unhealthy state. The value of unhealthy threshold ranges from 2 to 10. Default is 7.

properties.name: additional-attributes
properties.description: » Additional Attributes
In addition to the above, the following values are exported:

properties.name: operational_details
properties.description: • operational_details - Description of the operational state.

properties.name: state
properties.description: • state - State of the Origin Server Pool.

properties.name: status
properties.description: • status - Status of the Origin Server Pool.

properties.name: uri
properties.description: • uri - The Uniform Resource Identifier for the Server Pool.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Storage Container.

properties.name: read_acls
properties.description: • read_acls - (Optional) The list of ACLs that grant read access. See Setting Container ACLs.

properties.name: write_acls
properties.description: • write_acls - (Optional) The list of ACLs that grant write access. See Setting Container ACLs.

properties.name: primary_key
properties.description: • primary_key - (Optional) The primary secret key value for temporary URLs.

properties.name: secondary_key
properties.description: • secondary_key - (Optional) The secondary secret key value for temporary URLs.

properties.name: allowed_origins
properties.description: • allowed_origins - (Optional) List of origins that are allowed to make cross-origin requests.

properties.name: exposed_headers
properties.description: • exposed_headers - (Optional) List of headers exposed to the user agent (e.g. browser) in the actual request response

properties.name: max_age
properties.description: • max_age - (Optional) Maximum age in seconds for the origin to hold the preflight results.

properties.name: quota_bytes
properties.description: • quota_bytes - (Optional) Maximum size of the container, in bytes

properties.name: quota_count
properties.description: • quota_count - (Optional) Maximum object count of the container

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) Additional object metadata headers. See Container Metadata below for more information.

properties.name: setting-container-acls
properties.description: » Setting Container ACLs
The read_acl consists of a list of roles or referrer designations. The write_acls consists of a list of roles.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: roles can be built-in roles or custom roles. Custom roles are defined in the Users tab in the Oracle Cloud My Services console. For a role that was provisioned as part of another service instance, the format is domainName.serviceName.roleName. For a custom role, the format is domainName.roleName. Default Storage roles include:

properties.name: ${var.domain}.Storage.Storage_ReadOnlyGroup
${var.domain}.Storage.Storage_ReadWriteGroup
${var.domain}.Storage.Storage_Administrator
.r:value
properties.description: • referrer designation indicates the host (or hosts) for which read access to the container should be allowed or denied. When the server receives a request for the container, it compares the referrer designations specified in the Read ACL with the value of the Referer header in the request, and determines whether access should be allowed or denied. The syntax of the referrer designation is: .r:value

value indicates the host for which access to the container should be allowed. It can be a specific host name (example: .r:www.example.com), a domain (example: .r:.example.com), or an asterisk (.r:*) to indicate all hosts. Note that if .r:* is specified, objects in the container will be publicly readable without authentication.
A minus sign (-) before value (example: .r:-temp.example.com) indicates that the host specified in the value field must be denied access to the container.
By default, read access to a container does not include permission to list the objects in the container. To allow listing of objects as well, include the .rlistings directive in the ACL.

properties.name: container-metadata
properties.description: » Container Metadata

The metadata config defines a map of additional meta data header name value pairs. The additional meta data items are set as HTTP Headers on the container in the form X-Container-Meta-{name}: {value}, where {name} is the name of the metadata item {value} is the header content. For example:

metadata {
  "Foo-Bar" = "barfoo"
  "Tags" = "abc 123 xyz"
}
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Storage Object.

properties.name: container
properties.description: • container - (Required) The name of Storage Container the store the object in.
Note: One of content, file, or copy_from must be specified

properties.name: content
properties.description: • content - (Optional) Raw content in string-form of the data.

properties.name: file
properties.description: • file - (Optional) File path for the content to use for data.

properties.name: copy_from
properties.description: • copy_from - (Optional) name of an existing object used to create the new object as a copy. The value is in form container/object. You must UTF-8-encode and then URL-encode the names of the container and object.

properties.name: content_disposition
properties.description: • content_disposition - (Optional) Set the HTTP Content-Disposition header to specify the override behaviour for the browser, e.g. inline or attachment.

properties.name: content_encoding
properties.description: • content_encoding - (Optional) set the HTTP Content-Encoding for the object.

properties.name: content_type
properties.description: • content_type - (Optional) set the MIME type for the object.

properties.name: delete_at
properties.description: • delete_at - (Optional) The date and time in UNIX Epoch time stamp format when the system removes the object.

properties.name: etag
properties.description: • etag - (Optional) MD5 checksum value of the request body. Strongly Recommended.

properties.name: transfer_encoding
properties.description: • transfer_encoding - (Optional) Set to chunked to enable chunked transfer encoding.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description: • metadata - (Optional) Additional object metadata headers. See Object Metadata below for more information.

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: » Attributes
In addition to the attributes listed above, the following attributes are exported:

properties.name: id
properties.description: The combined container and object name path of the object.

properties.name: accept_ranges
properties.description: Type of ranges that the object accepts.

properties.name: content_length
properties.description: Length of the object in bytes.

properties.name: last_modified
properties.description: Date and Time that the object was created/modified in ISO 8601.

properties.name: object_manifest
properties.description: The dynamic large-object manifest object.

properties.name: timestamp
properties.description: Date and Time in UNIX EPOCH when the account, container, or object was initially created at the current version.

properties.name: transaction_id
properties.description: Transaction ID of the request.

properties.name: object-metadata
properties.description: » Object Metadata

The metadata config defines a map of additional meta data header name value pairs. The additional meta data items are set HTTP Headers on the object in the form X-Object-Meta-{name}: {value}, where {name} is the name of the metadata item {value} is the header content. For example:

metadata {
  "Foo-Bar" = "barfoo",
  "Sha256" = "e91ed4f93637379a7539cb5d8d0b5bca3972755de4f9371ab2e123e7b4c53680"
}
